ZOsDLOp9pJUh7jLtyVGhVg.text: Fishfinger wrap!!! And Moscow mules to die for! X

zIQR4TpCkNtsqh-nrPY75w.text: Fast and healthy 'fast food', perfect to go to for a brief break in between shopping around Carnaby Street area, or simply to enjoy a simple, no fuss bite to eat. Their breakfast food is served until 11am and there is a separate Lunch and Dinner menu. The lunch menu goes from 11 am to 6pm serving a choice of wrap (Mexican salsa chicken, aioli chicken), salads and a vegetable or meat soup (which changes daily). The dinner menu is very similar to the lunch one but with a few more extra dishes. Food in the evening also served on plates, where as during the lunch hours everything is a lot more casual. I tried one of their meaty soups which came with a piece of Greek flatbread which was handy for dunking into the sop and wiping up any left overs. The soup was warm and surprisingly filling, and I accompanied it with one of their flourless 'Better Brownies', made out Valhrona chocolate which is 70% cocoa. All if which was washed down with a large cup of steaming green tea.

moExhrEuiCr-NNSMYK5KGQ.text: When I first discovered Leon I was going through a healthy food phase, and when I looked at the menu stuck up in the window I got so excited- sweet potato falafels?! WOAH.They are amazing. As are most of the dishes, I always go for a pick and mix of lots, it seems to work out cheaper and more filling than just one main meal. The houmous is good as are the chicken pieces. Not a fan of the raw foods salad however, I am a human, not a rabbit. Also, the 'healthy' cakes are really good, but probably not so healthy. Better than a mars bar anyway.Leon is opening up more and more stores at the moment, I hope that is not going to ruin it's thus far great reputation in serving up delicious nutritious fast food at reasonable prices.

IpNzvoOS_dYH0wbSl80Mkg.text: I've never been here before. I say that because I'm astonished I haven't been dragged by a friend before. Because it's amazing. Offering real fresh eastern-influenced food served in card boxes and amazing ginger and lemon juices, this is 'food for thought' with a difference. When I went in last week they had a real meal deal, morrocan meatballs with rice and homemade 'slaw', hummus and flatbread, and a freshly squeezed juice, all for £6.85. It's more food than you need and makes you glow with health and goodness, and tastes great. I recommend it so highly.

xr79ExrbEMQV2CRVZBeR_A.text: I mostly agree with Carib Queen's review of Leon, Gt Marlborough St. However, I have to disagree in one particular respect. The service here can be appalling, and rude with it. I have been 'ignored' by staff here, as were a group of us on another occasion. On yet another occasion, the service ended with the words 'get out' as the food was thrust at me. All quite mystifying as my rule as a customer is to assume a polite demeanour. I accept that it is a fast food place so at busy times fast turnover is the rule, but there is no excuse for extraordinary rudeness. I've stopped going there as a result.

MzjUXiEd_sn0CqjQASe59A.text: This is a great place! they have only been around for a couple of years, but they are certainly doing well.The premis is healthy fast food, and it is all delicious.They do great salads, hot and cold, and they always have a selection of hot meals as well. All the food is organic, and they do great pudding s and smoothies.Also its not at all expensive, especially for the locations they are in.If you want a quick bite and you don't want macdonalds, then this is definately a much better alternative all round!

7oXdZMhpfcpDXq_aaLGpKg.text: pretty good fast and healthy food!  the hummus here is actually really good w/ chickpeas and a spicy sauce on top.  it comes w/ a pc of flat bread and makes for a good snack.

dVdmOuxLqtQV93nUm4KILA.text: remember the start of summer? that first heat wave we had that felt like the tropics with the moisture just waiting to break into a storm, which of course it did? my friend and i were starving and couldnt think about eating anything hot, so we went to Leons to get Salads. granted they tasted amazing. however for the price  - so not worth it. we were practically licking the boxes and finally left - still starving. we walked around for 20 min, waiting for the food to hit us. finally we said to hell with this and just went to pret to get some real food. i dunno. tasty, but just not enough. will think twice about going again. sure i could have just gotten two salads, but 14 pounds for a salad lunch from a "decent but not spectacular" food joint? no thanks.

LMM1baFPBSZe3KdPzYrMfA.text: Leon is now a substantial chain around London. It's quality, healthy fast-food. No burgers or subs here: expect sweet potato cakes, falafel, whole-grain rice, tasty soups, and salads. It's fresh ingredients, made all the time and served up fast in small cardboard containers. The interior is fun, colourful and funky. This location, right at the top of Carnaby Street, is great for for an after-shopping boost.

XzXrtmE_Xz9hVLfWQ61LGw.text: Tried this place 2x because I thought the menu was really eclectic and I was looking to spice up the normal lunch routine. Disappointed both times sad to say. The portions were small and the food was just barely warm. I heard someone in line say they really love the sweet potato dish but it had ingredients I don't eat. Maybe I'm too picky? Great concept, poor execution.

B9Rtcfb2rn1lGvCQzfo9uw.text: OK, I admit Leon is a great concept (health, sustainability, free-range - all that good stuff) and I'm thrilled it's taken off the way it has and when I lived around the corner, I used to grab dinner there at least a few nights a week.  You can be extremely virtuous here - ie the Superfood Salad, oil on the side - or more decadent - ie the meatballs with aioli; the dark chocolate brownie ("Better Brownie" does not = low-calorie), and they change the menu slightly based on the season.  My complaint is that Leon seems to have lost care and consistency (and perhaps has grown a bit lazy?) with its popularity.  The first Grilled Chicken Superfood Salads I remember having (when Leon was just a newborn) were perfect - lots of chicken and heaps of tomato, peas, seeds, quinoa etc.  More recently, I've gotten more than several salads that have just a few burnt, dark pieces of meat and/or are usually missing at least 2 of the ingredients (and I don't count one mini piece of browned broccoli as a present ingredient).  Other items are hit-or-miss... with the exception of the sweet potato falafel which I have always found to be yummy.I would also really like for Leon to upgrade their bread.  I know it's meant to be healthy, but it tastes like nothing - or perhaps like the similarly coloured paper boxes the food comes in...?

pQQglmhDQiLfyntRJYmf6g.text: Leon is a welcome addition to the food outlet scene. Serving interesting and delicious food with funky packaging.

-mU-AjZ7IcNA0ZKdo-37TQ.text: For a while there I thought Leon was going the way of horrible chain food outlets like Cafe Rouge, and the others you find littering the streets of any tourist zone. However, they seem to have pulled their socks up of late, and returned to what they do best - wholesome, tasty food - fast and (fairly) resonably priced. Great vegetarian selection, and good breakfasts too (Yoghurt with Granola and Compote). Avoid the coffee, and stick to the herbal teas and milkshakes. They do a mean cranberry flapjack too.

pDL4rlcYFgIPjFPMgK545g.text: Food at Leon is very healthy but also very tasty, you can get nice rice and chicken dishes as well as some nice salads which can be quite spicy if you ask for the right sauce. I would say that the food combines that what is similar to nandos peri peri style, its definitely worth a visit.

UbfHbF4CI6eiXWpY-VJBVw.text: This place is a chain of healthy organic style food. The décor is quite quirky and certainly very original. The take away food comes in recycled brown boxes and the whole place does have a very green feel to it. I think the fact that it is now a chain kills it slightly but it is nonetheless a good place to grab a tasty bit to eat. I've only ever tried the veggie wrap once, which was not the best thing I've had but I have heard many good reports from several friends of mine who have been more than once.

qLZkwsxsz3XNHAELN0-YZw.text: Humans are strange things eh? I've patronised Leon so much now that I'm almost bored of the place. 'Oh great, a healthy, affordable, inventive, seasonal way of eating out without the fuss associated with most sit-down restaurants.'  Leon is fun, colourful and the staff are helpful. I especially liked getting an email from Leon last year inviting me to a free tasting of their new autumn menu in their Strand outlet, beers included. Either me or someone I'm with (on my recommendation) almost always gets the sweet potato falafel when we visit. The same goes for the homemade lemonade and the apple and ginger-flavoured 'winter warmer'. So why on earth do I never go here anymore? If I can guess, it's something to do with the predictability of the place. The decor tries to be quirky but ends up looking virtually the same in every restaurant. And I struggle to name any other dish apart from the falafel, the chicken wings and the chicken salad... I would feel ridiculous giving Leon anything other than four stars, just make sure you don't visit here too much!

Zv7woe4Zr7QgN3Nrd3dKYw.text: Great, healthy, superfoods that are tasty, tasty, tasty. Bit pricey, pricey, pricey for a lunch too, but worth a treat now and again.

qdi4Edv1u1xJZh5Z6Kf2Gw.text: Very tasty food. Sometimes very busy, but worth the wait. Can be a bit expensive, but nice for a treat. Make sure you try a chocolate brownie from here - they are amazing!!

JyFLsHjnsf3Fs6gzR_xMdQ.text: Anyways i ordered a falfael sandwich and crispy french fries and a lemonade for 7£.. which you think would mean you could sit in and enjoy your meal, but you need to pay an extra £1 for that.. I am new here, but that kind of pisses me off. It was good though and I would eat here again in a pinch.

VD3HHAaAtVqfrXDBAS3iCQ.text: This place is great. Fancy-ish and filling food yet not bank breaking! Well ok maybe not so fancy, the place is in a fancy neighborhood and the decor seems a little nicer than most fast food chain restaurants. They even dimmed the lights and added a little candle while we were sitting there eating an early dinner. awwwI ordered the chicken salad (it had bacon in it, duh) and this was where the fanciness level dipped a bit. They used what looked like plain boiled chicken, texture wasn't bad but no flavor, and romaine lettuce and spinach as the greens. I mean it just looked like a salad I made at home with whatever was in my fridge. But whatever getting past my snootiness over presentation it tasted good.MUST TRY the lemon ginger crunch. The blessed little waiter asked if we would like it warmed with ice cream on top. What kind of question is that!? Who wouldn't want hot and cold and sweet and tangy and crunchy in their mouth at the same time!!!! I mean...yes please :)

0iAkantsOtAdlhoXTfAUTg.text: A delightful surprise not evident on first glance.This establishment appears, on first glance, to be a fast food takeaway counter.  Now don't get me wrong, there's nothing wrong with that.  But if you're looking for a great sit-down meal with a cafe ambiance, the little entryway to the right of he front counter is really easy to miss.  Even upon inspection, the little passage may be off-putting.  I swung past 3 times before actually entering and walking back.  Good thing I did!  A lovely cafe, intimate and so cool.  It was totally isolated from the street bustle, especially when the lads are in the streets drinking from the adjacent pub.  The menu is expanded from what's available at the counter and it changes seasonally. The service is warm, genial and welcoming.  I tell everyone about his little hidden gem and each time I visit London on business, I have dinner at Leon.  I know there are multiple locations, but this is the only one I've visited.

n4Lgt_ablek_ukZyOcQ5ug.text: I kind of regret stumbling upon this spot the last day of our visit.  Particularly because the food was good, inexpensive, and it was right across from our hotel.Sigh.I particularly liked their lunchbox combo deals as it came with ample food for 2 (my mom and I shared the meal) and their lemonade is definitely fresh = tart.We chose the Morroccan meatball lunchbox which came with brown rice, salad, and hummus with flatbread.  (Oh yeah, they're pretty healthy and earth-friendly.)  The meatballs have a tiny kick to them, but were really tasty.  The brown rice nice and fluffy, and the salad...well, my mom ate it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Lunchbox #2 - Morroccan Meatballs, Brown Rice, Salad w/ Hummus and Flatbread and a lemonade

RrS3ZS6dwnuoc_6j0WkY2A.text: This is a fantastic spot for a fresh brekkie or lunch.  On my last trip to London I (literally) stumbled upon the front door after a l_o_n_g  night that ended when Leon opened for breakfast.  Lucky me!  Not normally a fan of chain anything to do with food, but this is almost shockingly good.  Super fresh ingredients of the highest quality and a staff that vaguely appears interested in the happiness and well-being of their customers.  They keep the menu limited, yet interesting and seem to understand both how to keep the favorites in their culinary rotation and incorporate customer feedback.  They even make a decent coffee!  My faves were the crunchy baps for breakfast and EVERY salad for anything else.   I was not a particular fan of the Moroccan meatballs which, to me, lacked the proper spice combo and definition.The only question I have is why haven't they licensed the concept to some enterprising Canadian?  Oh wait.... I'M and enterprising Canadian!  Pretty clever, eh?

HWvPj_nyTE6gZTP3bbmqRw.text: I guess you could call this the 'healthy fast food.' It comes out very quick, on a tray, in a box and you take it away and eat it. While the menu is great and flavours are good it does have that fast food feel to it - things that are supposed to be hot...aren't quite there, and there isn't that same sense of freshness.... Not bad though, i'm sure i'll be eating there a lot more in the future, just won't go calling it my favourite!

lV_9beoxLw7WXRf7KS2AJg.text: This revolutionary natural foods restaurant/ café will change the way you think about food! Now that I think about it Leon is one of the best reasons I come to Carnaby Street. For starters, this restaurant chooses their menu based on the time of year the food is in season- the way food should be consumed. Leon remixes foods you are familiar with such as chicken or salmon with flavours like chilli, Mexican salsa and alioli. I am in love with the clean and refreshing interior along with the art deco-ish theme. There's a delicious selection of breakfast foods including yoghurt and porridge all for around 2! Also, there's a great selection of classic British favourites- with a twist!

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

EXCc8kS84XMf2J5h6TjOVA.text: I love the light fresh food they serve at Leon.  I remember discovering Leon when it first opened on Carnaby Street, and relishing on its simple concept and healthy food.  However, I cannot help but feel that Leon has now given in to becoming a profit-making machine as it slowly becomes a chain.  The locations have increased and the prices have inflated.  It is still however, a great concept and I cannot deny that the food is good.Leon serves up a range of fresh foods such as soups, juices, salads, aioli chicken, wraps, falafel, and different seasonal dishes.  My personal favourite is the Moroccan Meatball hot dish, served with brown rice and coleslaw vegetables.  For those of you who enjoy fresh juices organic juices, this place could also quench your thirst.  All of the meals are served in recyclable, brown paper boxes and the decorations are sometimes a bit quirky.  Leon can now be found in 8 different locations.  You can refer to the website for more information.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

K1ICdYbpucqKzz1rNxlwow.text: I'm a big fan of Leon. Full Stop.This little restaurant is super great because of it's location. If you find yourself in and around Oxford or Carnaby Streets (heaven forbid) and peckish, this is the place to come. It's a beacon of hope and fresh tasty food in a sea of abysmal cheap food counters.It's not my favourite Leon, I think i'll reserve that title for their Spitalfields spot, but it's very handy and well worth the visit.

3a2uUXjrqXFgRvUJjwuxLw.text: Every time I come here I always think to myself why don't I come here more often. The reason is it's a little out of my way from my office and it gets really busy on Carnaby Street.I'm never disappointed by the food here. Fresh, delicious, filling food! I'm going to buy the cook books!

ODZNOkvO3WigJPi5U7NOjQ.text: I went here for breakfast with Jess this morning, and as always, walked away happy.It's nice and healthy, and the menu is packed full of crazy power smoothies and juices (check the ginger and carrot). Plus, there's practically no wait at all.That's the difference here, it's like fast food without the grease.This morning I was naughty and had a bacon roll, which comes in a whole-wheat crunchy bap with perfectly cooked bacon (*proper* bacon! Not McDonalds 'bacon') and homemade ketchup! Divine! Small enough not to feel guilty, large enough to fill a hole. I also had a black coffee and water, so the total came to £5.40. Not bad at all. That's probably what I'd pay for a Starbucks (and feel not only hungry but on a sugar low just an hour later).I've also had a sweet potato falafel wrap here before (a little big, but pretty good) - and they do takeaway curries and stews as well.Sitting outside at 9.00am is lovely when the sun's out, with Carnaby Street a stone's throw away. It's metal patio furniture and wobbly tables ahoy, but for a catch up with someone you're just going to natter away to with little pause for breath, it's perfect.

dhvCwkt2K7FdUmC3s1oMGw.text: You need 3-4 small plates per person to make a meal.  So even though each small plate is about 3-5 pounds, it adds up quickly.  Also, I make some of these dishes at home, and I'm by no means a gourmet cook, so when I say I can do better -- it means that the dish was pretty bad.  I make better Moroccan meatballs (these are really closer to Italian meatballs, and bland to boot).  The grilled halloumi is like rubber (dessicated, disgusting, tough, salty rubber).  The sweet potato falafel was mushy (insufficiently fried to hold it's shape).  The chili chicken was boiled with onions, with a dash of non-spicy red sauce on top (why even bother calling it a chili sauce was beyond me).  The hummus was ok, but the flatbread was gross (fried, oily, and not warm at the table).  The broccoli with garlic and red pepper was average (I could do better).  The sunshine salad was mostly edamame -- but was good.    The service was awkward because our table required that the waitresses reach around my boyfriend's head to do anything.  The only plusses are that it was around the corner from Oxford Circus, it does have seating, and it's warmer inside than on the street.

UJa8oXA1UM04nCbe4QlkPg.text: Yum, yum! I love Leon, it's a great place to eat on Carnaby Street.My favourite thing about this place is the freshness of the food and the relaxed atmosphere - I find Carnaby Street a little pretentious at times. The place is usually quite busy, obviously it's Carnaby Street, but the fresh sandwiches and tasty juices are more than enough to keep you satisfied.A brilliant little shopping break if you need it, highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

9u7W5_WPMC1yAC_vHjDkSA.text: Plenty has already been said about Leon, but there are a few things that I would like to add. I do love the concept of this place - there are too many unnecessarily expensive restaurants which value style over substance popping up in London, and far too many chains where the food might as well have been created in a petri dish because there are no nutrients left. It is for these reasons that I value Leon. The concept of fresh, seasonal and primarily organic food is much needed in London. A couple of weeks ago, when I was feeling run down, and my pockets were feeling empty, I popped into Leon and picked up a Superfood special - a mackerel superfood dish, a juice and an apple for £4.95. The food was delicious, so no complaints there. I will say though, that I want to keep an eye on Leon, I sincerely hope that it does not follow the formula of other expanding restaurants where the prices go up in direct correlation to the sizes of the meals shrinking, and most importantly the quality of the food decreasing. I have heard a few, but not many whispers about this with Leon. For now I will say that I think the quality is still as good as the day when it first started.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

xHYcS-xf56AEC48lzIqg1w.text: I've dabbled with Leon before, and I can honestly say that I'm not a fan of the seeds that they put in the rice, but aside from this, the chilli chicken wrap is outta this world! The moroccan meatballs do the job too! Definitley does the job as far as lunch goes, but everytime I eat there, I instantly want more...!Oh and you gotta get the Strawberry, Mango & Passion fruit yoghurt pot, it's divine!!!

JxOSMTgymOh1eYg0Iwc-UA.text: I'm saddened to say that the standards of Leon really have really gone downhill - I've just had the chilli chicken hot box - what a waste of money! I wouldn't call what was in the box chicken in fact most of it was fat and gristle:( Too much mayonnaise on the coleslaw and the mayonnaise tastes like a cheap and nasty brand. The brownie which used to be one of my favourite things is not as chocolatey and rich as before. It is sad because they did start a trend in good, fast and healthy food - and I think it fast but none of the other two!

6YppEeA15Y10iKuFPhEjug.text: Jane hearts Leon SOOOOOOOO MUUUUUUCH.Just one minus point for being quite pricey--no matter how much I love them, I cannot afford +5GBP every day for lunch--but four very enthusiastic stars for deelishy lunch and fantastically helpful and friendly staff. I have finally found my very favourite lunch in the area surrounding my office, and it a mere 45 seconds from my desk. I started off getting the aioli chicken wrap with no pickles, but then decided to be totally cheeky and see if they would make me a special one with halloumi instead of chicken. OMIGOD. OH. EM. GEE. Seriously? Bestthingever. I can't imagine it is terribly good for the waistline, but jeez is it delicious. I went back the next day and got the same lady at the cash register, and she smiled and asked "Your special halloumi ailoi wrap again, madam?" I hope she remembered my order because she's nice and not because I am one of those horrible customers ruined forever by the Starbucks-customization-entitlement-complex which makes one feel entitled to make ridiculous demands of all subsequent coffee shops and lunch spots. Whatever the case, every time I've gone into this shop since that day, I've gotten my same girl who has remembered my stupid special order without flinching, and been so nice about my ridiculous demands.I've never had a single bad thing at Leon. Their curry boxes are amazing, their wraps are to die for, and their dinnertime selection includes THE BEST EFFING CHORIZO IN HISTORY. I hate ginger, and I even love their lemon-ginger bars.Oh, and my very favourite part of Leon? An adorable, friendly, chipper, smiley, sandy-blonde, darling little gap-year kid named Lane working at the counter, who is from a teeny, obscure little town in California, 20 MILES FROM MY OWN LITTLE TEENY, OBSCURE HOMETOWN IN CALIFORNIA. And our names effing rhyme. I can't get over him. I totally heart Lane.I super duper wish I could afford to go here more often. I loves me some Leon.

tGLfmiYk-dUIcCD1ogUl7g.text: Great takeaway. I don't like waiting in long lines and I think the people here know that  they are doing everything possible to serve all the customers as fast as they can. The food is delicious and always hot.

Mr-zBKnsC3IzMbyRgQWggw.text: Tasty, fresh and good value.My personal favorites are there are:I love England bap (Breakfasts)Sweet Potato FalafelMeatballsFreedom Chicken with Rice & ColeslawYou really can't go to far wrong in here though. Not to mention the service is always really charming...

JaAFQGVEqfF-8TKfXO-OKQ.text: affordable, tasty, good-for-you food. fresh and free range to boot. for brekkie, there's poached egg in a cup w/ ham hocks, beans and sour doughy toast. so good with butter. even better dipped in egg. and man, those grilled chicken aioli flatbread wraps are just unputdownable.

39uoRn6Goc4XsvUxllC1AQ.text: Right next to hotel I was staying at and was convenient to do a quick pick up. I like Leon, good set of choices from all over the world and the food is always good.

RQTUYNaB8AEgTrJz6anwOA.text: Really good fast food. I'm a healthy eater, so I haven't had fast food in years. It was so nice to be handed my food, healthy food, immediately! My favorite entree is the aioli chicken, served with brown rice & slaw (healthy slaw with no cream). My favorite sides are the pea salad, hummus, & waffle fries. The prices are affordable. This restaurant is quite small--best for take away.  Highly recommend for a quick, cheap meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Pea salad--delicious!

njuRr65x19FFKVhVhIxmMQ.text: There's a big difference between fast-food and food...fast. This place is a great example of that. My wife and I were strolling through London and looking to pick up a quick, cheap bite at a place we'd never heard of and Leon was staring us in the face. Fortunately, we were not disappointed. In fact, we were really quite impressed! The staff was helpful, considering we had never been here before and the options were really enticing. We decided on the Thai Green Curry Chicken and the Sweet Potato Falafel. Both were really great choices, very tasty, and with substantial portions for the price. Leon's menu tries tries bridge the gap between cost, speed, healthiness, and quality. From our experience they are doing a great job of it and we would definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Sweet potato falafel. Really excellent. Would definitely get it again!
Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Thai green curry chicken. No complaints!
Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Some of the menu options.

Jw0viG_dUu7DRCue7pJdGA.text: Have you ever heard of a fast food restaurant that serves actually good, fresh, and healthy food? Well, Leon is it! I was very surprised when I looked at their menu. They do not have the typical greasy food regular fast food chains serve. The food is served in brown boxes and are of good servings despite the affordable prices. The servers and cashiers were very friendly and they actually sing! They take turns to go around and sing standard songs to the customers which makes Leon a fun place too!

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

DuzaKpLbAbom-iZNpEQTSQ.text: I love this place, nice food, music and  graphics around you, inspiring and great place for meeting. Plus, the food " properties " (gluten free, vegan, etc) are easy to catch

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

4M-K8BO1YvI4TUCMJ_IOCw.text: A delicious, fast, fresh, and healthy option if you're in a rush or just want something yummy that will make you feel great. I personally love the Gobi box.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Gobi box
Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Sweet potato felafel box

QPzRL0xf_jS40j82iwPv4A.text: Good spot for a healthy, but fast, meal. I got the chicken rice box with aioli and it was lovely, especially the tender chicken. Whole place has a great vibe and layout.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

ogyohJmKYP1v_V0AwhovpQ.text: We ate at Leons on Shaftsbury, across from the Queens Theatre and the food ranged from "gross" to "just not good." Not only that, but the single toilet was out of order! How can you run a loud, busy restaurant without even a sink or toilet? I would never go back to a Leon.

joz1D1yOrn_y57dEZ0uLhw.text: One of my staple lunch spots.  I always try and convince myself I'm eating super healthy - but I know sometimes that is not the case.  The quality of the food is good, and it's always SUPER fast, which is great.  I do get a little bored with the menu, as it's quite small.  But overall, I like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Vegan superclean quinoa salad

QwNaS-EVeoupyTRqVjdXMg.text: Leon is definitely the best fast-ish food place for gluten-free eaters and people who need to eat quickly and don't want to eat junk.I've visited a few Leons, and they're reliably good. This one is located right near Soho which makes it a great stop before a night out. This time I had the Moroccan chicken with brown rice, which was good and well prepared. You felt like you were eating actual food, if you know what I mean! I've even uploaded a photo of it. My favorite part is that they have all sorts of gluten free desserts: brownies, traybakes, and even pecan pie! Gluten-free notes: These people make it really easy with each dish labelled as GF (gluten free), WF (wheat free), DF (dairy free) and even give tips to vegetarians and vegans.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Moroccan chicken with brown rice and coleslaw-like veggies. Gluten free! Also tasty.

5qNvYJUqqFM_INrgqYn-Rw.text: Viv and Tom..you guys had more energy than guys getting coffee here.. Before even thinking twice you offered me free breakfast when I forgot my wallet..Their service has always been good but this is one level up

h1vwrhbYjg1--4ezzLfwrg.text: I'm a big fan, and I'm surprised to be since it's very much "fast food"! The salads were fresh and pretty good - I got a club salad. Definitely ask for the dressing on the side if you tend to not like too much of it. I also got the lime-ade (be warned, it's VERY lime and very concentrated).

OrKfRByB6ZfhQb-8lkhbuw.text: Leon is the best!  It's the greatest "fast food" there is, so fresh and healthy.  We came late after a day of walking around, and I enjoyed the Chargrilled Chicken Superfood Salad which had tons of fresh, yummy veggies and a nice herbal flavor.  The crushed pea salad and superfood quinoa pot made great sides for us to share - you can easily split one of them between two people, and there were four of us.  My parents and fiancé loved their food as well, the Moroccan Meatballs are always a hit.  The servers were so nice too - my mom somehow charmed the server so much that she gave us free dessert - Billionaire's shortbread and a brownie!  And they were AMAZING so after all that healthy food, feel free to indulge on desserts, they are worth it (esp. when free.  haha.)This is a small location, but it isn't just a storefront.  They have seating round the back and on a small patio when the weather is nice.  Great place for a quick, cheap, fresh meal.

uikuwlFWteQ8dMpliEO-Tw.text: Easily my favourite 'fast - food' in central London, I've had the chicken & chorizo club box nearly every time I went but I've tried also their salmon and their meatballs and everything is always so tasty.  Their baked fries nicely complement any meal and if you like garlic you can't not dip them into the aioli sauce! I wish this particular branch were a bit more spacious in regards to seats but it's perfect for quick lunch dates and take out.  Oh, and if you like your brownie every now and then make sure to grab their loyalty card!

uzyyfiT43rmeSqIOIsrSqA.text: The format has changed slightly in the evening, but it has been a while since I was last here. Now order and collect at the service desk and you can take it in the back to eat. Like a healthy McDonalds! Food delicious could eat this food every day. Must start cooking it too! Highly recommended for super healthy fast food. Until next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Falafel box with Hummus and flatbread and to drink, lemon, lime and ginger. Delicious!

I9f9OT6xJXpbS5hQoe8spw.text: Was right across the street the prices were ok and food small but just the right amount. They serve portage, egg w meet sandwich , or yogurt w fruit. It was just a nice quick stop

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

gJ2OmdkgvlyfODDhxLZUyw.text: To me Leon is known for it's healthy food and out of the many competitors I really rate Leon. It has a good and tasty selection. I particularly like the lemon chicken and herb with brown rice. Super healthy and tasty grub.

hnIGGHNazddVVurvlBrG3A.text: No time but want to get a healthy meal on the go? No my friend the only option out there is not a boring McDonald's so called "salad"? Go to Leon.  You wait in line and then have the option to take away or sit in (limited seating). Leon offers a variety of choices from breakfast (porridges, eggs) to lunch/dinner (soups, burgers, fries, wraps, salads, hot boxes) all with healthy ingredients (mackerel, sweet potatoes, halloumi, quinoa). One star off because I am a soup fan especially in this freezing winter and I wish they had bigger portions and more choices. But that is really up to me.In a nutshell: fast-food can actually be fast-healthy food

NmIG9HQapEz8AuPOyNz33g.text: Chilli Chicken Hot Box. That's all I've ever gotten at Leon and that's all I need. It comes with some chilli sauce, some yogurt, brown rice, cabbage, and chicken. For less than £6 I think that's decent.Their wheat free brownies are good, as are the fresh lemon and lime-aids. Try it out when you need a quick bite. A great alternative to the ubiquitous Pret!

kE68HoGbTqmDBMHFzplD8Q.text: Came in for a late saturday morning breakfast.Had an egg pot, toast and a flat white (five quid).The egg pot had ham hock and a creamy sauce. The meat was delicious in combination with the egg but I was 50/50 on the sauce. Toast is toast and the coffee was similar to anywhere on the high street.But where Leon excelled was the atmosphere. The server and chef were friendly, both to me and each other and it was all very relaxed. They were playing some absolute tunes, think The Specials - Blank Expression. I sat reading my book and felt peaceful, it was awesome.
